description: Since 22nd April 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe is enforcing compulsory daily curfew of the entire population, starting at 7 pm, throughout the National territory, except for specific cases that will be regulated, depending on the nature of some services, under penalty of offenders incurring a crime of disobedience.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: No the curfew times are always the same regardless of the day of the week

description: On March 17th, 2020, Sao Tome and Principe government announces national state of emergency starting from March 20th.

description: On March 17th, 2020, Sao Tome and Principe government announces national state of emergency starting from March 20th. UPDATE: The state of emergency was renewed for the fifth time until 16 of June
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: On March 17th, 2020, Sao Tome and Principe government announces national state of emergency starting from March 20th. The State of emergency ended on 16th June and it was substituted to the state of calamity. UPDATE: The State of Emergency lasted until 16th of June
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: The San Tomean government declared today the Situation of Public Calamity throughout the country, with effect from 16th of June, revoking the mandatory general confinement that ends because of the Covid-19 that ends 15th of June.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date

description: On March 4th, The Sao Tome and Principe government approved the National Contingency Plan for the Epidemic due to COVID-19 presented by the Ministry of Health, which highlights the measures of surveillance, prevention, containment, hygiene and the involvement of the most varied sectors of national life, taking into account the transversality of matter. It was also decided to create an emergency fund to support the actions of this plan, in the first phase of implementation, in the amount of USD 500,000.00.
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: One or more geographical or administrative units (other than provincial or city level units) within one or more countries

description: São Tomé and Príncipe strengthens the national response against COVID-19 by certifying the Chamber of the National Reference Laboratory with WHO support. On 20th July 2020, the World Health Organization announced that the work of certification of the Laminar Flow Chamber – cabins – of the National Reference Laboratory was completed. The operationalization of these chambers will allow the multiplication of PCR tests that until now were carried out in a limited way.

target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description:
Government of São Tomé decrees mandatory general confinement. The exception are outings for quick purchases and medical emergency situations. The measure does not cover employees in key sectors.
 UPDATE: The national government is implementing Phase 1 of the reopening of economy, that phase includes the revoke of the mandatory lockdown. This phase planned to last from 16 to 30 June.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 4th September 2020, the World Bank and the World Health Organization (WHO) under the supervision of the Santomense Government signed a Memorandum of Understanding of Support to the National Health System in response to the Covid-19 pandemic and other possible emergencies in the country. The Memorandum aims to strengthen the capacity of the Government of Sao Tome and Principe, immediately to respond to the COVID-19 outbreak and, in the long term, strengthen capacities for the International Health Regulation (IHR) for health safety and the National System for The Preparation and Response to Public Health Emergencies in general.
date_end_spec: The policy has a clear end date
type: New Task Force, Bureau or Administrative Configuration
target_geog_level: One or more countries, but not all countries

description: On 06 Apr 2020, The Central Bank of São Tomé and Príncipe (BCSTP) announced the reduction of minimum cash reserves from 18 to 14% in national currency, and from 21% to 17% in foreign currency, due to the crisis caused by covid-19.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_text: Monetary policy determinated by the central bank of the government
enforcer: Other (Please specify in the text box)

description: On July 23th, African Development Fund gives $10 million to Sao Tome and Principe to mitigate the impact of COVID- 19, with the overall objective of protecting lives and livelihoods. The package of policy measures agreed with Government include strengthening health systems to cope with the surge in hospitalisations and scaling up testing and tracing systems; expanding social protection systems to cushion its most vulnerable populations; and to provide cash relief to Micro, Small and Medium Enterprises(SMEs).
date_end_spec: The policy has an imprecise natural end date (e.g. masks will be distributed until they run out)
target_geog_level: An international organization (e.g. World Health Organization)

description: As of April 07,2020, nationals of São Tomé and Príncipe and foreign residents will be subject to quarantine upon arrival.

description: On April 6th 2020, the government Sao Tome and Principe implemented a single schedule for commercial stores and supermarkets, which will be from 08:30h to 17:00h. The Municipal and District markets are only open until 4pm and the sale by sidewalks is strictly prohibited.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On April 6th 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe declared that all restaurants, bars, cafes, pastry shops and mobile homes must close, with the exception of those with home delivery services from 8th April onwards.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: The São Toméan government on 22nd April 2020 announced the closure of Fardo Market from 24th April 2020 onwards and the vendors are allowed to sell their products on the front of their houses respecting all the sanitary measures in force.

description: On April 6th 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe declared the prohibition of meetings, gatherings and meetings with more than 10 people, which took effect on April 8th, 2020.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On April 6th 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe established a limit of occupancy of seats for passengers, in taxis and private vehicles, up to half the legal capacity of the vehicles; and this policy takes effect from April 8th 2020 onwards.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On 21st  April 2020, the government of Sao Tome Principe announced funerals and wakes should not be held with more than 20 persons from 24th April 2020 onwards.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On April 6th 2020, the government of Sao Tome and Principe declared obligation to respect the sanitary distance of 2 meters, use of masks by employees and provision of washbasins or alcohol for the disinfestation of customers and users, in all institutions, public or private, that provide services to the public and the policy to take effect from April 8, 2020 onwards.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported

description: On 22nd April 2020, the Sao Tome and Principe government declared that all citizens on public roads and all providers of services to the public should wear protective masks. The policy takes effect from 24th April 2020 onwards.
date_end_spec: The policy’s end date is unknown or unreported
type_sub_cat: Wearing Masks in all public spaces/everywhere
